v.v: I have made a covenant with my eyes;
For what is the portion from God above,
I used to think that calamity is for unrighteous people,
Does not God see my ways

v: how then should I look with desire on a virgin?
the inheritance from the Almighty on high?
and that disaster is for doers of wickedness.
and count all my steps?

v.v: If I have walked with falsehood,
let me be weighed in an even balance
If my step has turned aside from the way,
then let me sow, and let another eat,

v: if my foot has hurried to deceit,
so that God will know my integrity.
if my heart has gone after my eyes,
if any spot has stuck to my hands,
and let my crops be uprooted.

v.v: If my heart has been deceived by a woman,
then let my wife grind grain for another,
For that would be a terrible crime;
For that is a fire that consumes as far as Abaddon,
If I ignored the plea for justice from my male or female servant
what then would I do when God rises up to accuse me?
Did the one who made me in the womb not make them also?

v: if I have lain in wait at my neighbor’s door,
and let others bow down on her.
indeed, it would be a crime to be punished by judges.
and it would burn all my harvest to the root.
when they argued with me,
When he comes to judge me, how would I answer him?
Did not the same one mold us all in the womb?

v.v: If I have withheld poor people from their desire,
or if I have eaten my morsel alone
because from my youth the orphan grew up with me as with a father,
If I have seen anyone perish for lack of clothing,
if his heart has not blessed me
if I have lifted up my hand against fatherless people
If I have done these things, then let my shoulder fall from the shoulder blade,
For I dreaded destruction from God;

v: or if I have caused the eyes of the widow to grow dim from crying,
and not allowed those without fathers to eat it also—
and I have guided his mother, a widow, from my own mother’s womb.
or if I have seen that a needy man had no clothing;
because he has not been warmed with the wool of my sheep,
because I saw my support in the city gate,
then bring charges against me!
and let my arm be broken from its joint.
because of his majesty, I was not able to do those things.

v.v: If I have made gold my hope,
if I have rejoiced because my wealth was great,
If I have seen the sun when it shone,
and if my heart has been secretly attracted,
this also would be a crime to be punished by judges,
If I have rejoiced at the destruction of anyone who hated me
Indeed, I have not even allowed my mouth to sin
If the men of my tent have never said,
(even the foreigner has never had to stay in the city square,
If, like mankind, I have hidden my sins
(because I feared the great multitude,
Oh, if only I had someone to hear me!
Surely I would carry it openly on my shoulder;
I would declare to him an accounting for my steps;
If my land ever cries out against me,
if I have eaten its harvest without paying for it
then let thorns grow instead of wheat

v: and if I have said to fine gold, ‘You are what I am confident in’;
because my hand had gotten many possessions,
then bring charges against me!
or the moon walking in its brightness,
so that my mouth has kissed my hand in worship of them—
for I would have denied the God who is above.
or congratulated myself when disaster overtook him,
then bring charges against me!
by asking for his life with a curse.
‘Who can find one who has not been filled with Job’s food?’
because I have always opened my doors to the traveler),
and if that is not so, then bring charges against me!
by hiding my guilt inside my tunic
because the contempt of families terrified me,
so that I kept silent and would not go outside),
then bring charges against me!
See, here is my signature; let the Almighty answer me!
If only I had the indictment that my opponent has written!
I would put it on like a crown.
as a confident prince I would go up to him.
and its furrows weep together,
or have caused its owners to lose their lives,
and weeds instead of barley.”
